org.chronos.chronograph.api.index

Interface ChronoGraphIndexManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChronoGraphIndexManagerInternal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChronoGraphIndexManagerImpl, ThreadedChronoGraphIndexManager

    public interface ChronoGraphIndexManager
    The ChronoGraphIndexManager is responsible for managing the secondary indices for a ChronoGraph instance.

    You can get the instance of your graph by calling ChronoGraph.getIndexManager().

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • create

        IndexBuilderStarter create()
        Starting point for the fluent graph index creation API.

        Use method chaining on the returned object, and call GraphElementIndexBuilder.build() on the last builder to create the new index.

        Adding a new graph index marks that particular index as dirty. When you are done adding all your secondary indices to the graph, call reindexAll() in order to build them.

        Returns:
        The next builder in the fluent API, for method chaining. Never null.

      • createIndex

        @Deprecated
default ElementTypeChoiceIndexBuilder createIndex()
        Deprecated. Use create().stringIndex() instead.
        Creates a string index.

        This method is outdated. Please use: 

         create().stringIndex()
        instead for the same effect.
        Returns:
        The index builder, for method chaining. Never null.

      • getIndexedPropertiesOf

        java.util.Set<ChronoGraphIndex> getIndexedPropertiesOf(java.lang.Class<? extends org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Element> clazz)
        Returns the currently available secondary indices for the given graph element class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Either Vertex.class or Edge.class. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The currently available secondary indices for the given graph element class. May be empty, but never null.
        See Also:
        getIndexedVertexProperties(), getIndexedEdgePropertyNames(), getIndexedEdgeProperties(), getIndexedEdgePropertyNames()

      • getIndexedVertexProperties

        default java.util.Set<ChronoGraphIndex> getIndexedVertexProperties()
        Returns the currently available secondary indices for vertices.
        Returns:
        The currently available secondary indices for vertices. May be empty, but never null.
        See Also:
        getIndexedVertexPropertyNames(), getIndexedEdgeProperties(), getIndexedEdgePropertyNames()

      • getIndexedVertexPropertyNames

        default java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getIndexedVertexPropertyNames()
        Returns the names (keys) of the vertex properties that are currently part of a secondary index.
        Returns:
        The set of indexed vertex property names (keys). May be empty, but never null.
        See Also:
        getIndexedVertexProperties(), getIndexedEdgeProperties(), getIndexedEdgePropertyNames()

      • getIndexedEdgePropertyNames

        default java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getIndexedEdgePropertyNames()

        Returns:
        The set of indexed edge property names (keys). May be empty, but never null.
        See Also:
        getIndexedVertexProperties(), getIndexedVertexPropertyNames(), getIndexedEdgeProperties()

      • getAllIndices

        default java.util.Set<ChronoGraphIndex> getAllIndices()
        Returns the set of all currently available secondary graph indices.
        Returns:
        The set of all secondary graph indices. May be empty, but never null.

      • getVertexIndex

        default ChronoGraphIndex getVertexIndex(java.lang.String indexedPropertyName)
        Returns the vertex index for the given property name (key).
        Parameters:
        indexedPropertyName - The name (key) of the vertex property to get the secondary index for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The secondary index for the given property, or null if the property is not indexed.

      • getEdgeIndex

        default ChronoGraphIndex getEdgeIndex(java.lang.String indexedPropertyName)
        Returns the edge index for the given property name (key).
        Parameters:
        indexedPropertyName - The name (key) of the edge property to get the secondary index for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The secondary index for the given property, or null if the property is not indexed.

      • isPropertyIndexed

        default boolean isPropertyIndexed(java.lang.Class<? extends org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Element> clazz,
                                  java.lang.String property)
        Checks if the given property name (key) is indexed for the given graph element class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The graph element class to check (either Vertex.class or Edge.class). Must not be null.
        property - The name (key) of the property to check. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the given property is indexed for the given graph element class, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isVertexPropertyIndexed(String), isEdgePropertyIndexed(String)

      • isVertexPropertyIndexed

        default boolean isVertexPropertyIndexed(java.lang.String property)
        Checks if the given Vertex property name (key) is indexed or not.
        Parameters:
        property - The vertex property name (key) to check. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the given property is indexed on vertices, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isEdgePropertyIndexed(String)

      • isEdgePropertyIndexed

        default boolean isEdgePropertyIndexed(java.lang.String property)
        Checks if the given Edge property name (key) is indexed or not.
        Parameters:
        property - The edge property name (key) to check. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the given property is indexed on edges, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isVertexPropertyIndexed(String)

      • reindexAll

        void reindexAll()
        Rebuilds all secondary graph indices from scratch.

        This operation is mandatory after adding/removing graph indices. Depending on the backend and size of the database, this operation may take considerable amounts of time and should be used with care.

      • reindex

        @Deprecated
void reindex(ChronoGraphIndex index)
        Deprecated. As of Chronos 0.6.8 or later, please use reindexAll() instead.
        Recreates the index with the given name.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to recreate. Must not be null. Must refer to an existing index.

      • dropIndex

        void dropIndex(ChronoGraphIndex index)
        Drops the given graph index.

        This operation cannot be undone. Use with care.

        Parameters:
        index - The index to drop. Must not be null.

      • dropAllIndices

        void dropAllIndices()
        Drops all graph indices.

        This operation cannot be undone. Use with care.

      • isReindexingRequired

        boolean isReindexingRequired()
        Checks if reindexing is required or not.

        Reindexing is required if at least one graph index is dirty.

        Returns:
        true if at least one graph index requires rebuilding, otherwise false.

      • getDirtyIndices

        java.util.Set<ChronoGraphIndex> getDirtyIndices()
        Returns the set of secondary graph indices that are currently dirty, i.e. require re-indexing.
        Returns:
        The set of dirty secondary indices. May be empty, but never null.
